result.execSummary:
The defendant Cecilio Albert Garcia was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Heroin(>10-50g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(d)3.
  • Possess w/Intent-Cocaine (>1-5g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(cm)1r.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
AS TO EACH COUNT:  Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample, and to pay all MANDATORY COURT costs, fees, assessments, and surcharges through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Cash bail to apply.  Defendant to make regular monthly payments.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Pay all supervision fees.  Defendant to make regular payments.
Concurrent with: CONCURRENT TO COUNT 2, and CONSECUTIVE with any other sentence, with credit for 3 DAYS time served.

superMiscConds.notes: Seek and maintain full time employment.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon that he may never possess a firearm.
No association with known drug users or dealers, and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.

ANY treatment and counseling programs as determined by agent.
Court ordered that the defendant cannot vote until civil rights are restored upon completion of sentence.

AODA assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.
Maintain absolute sobriety, no controlled substances without a valid prescription, with random drug tests and breathalyzers.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cecilio Albert Garcia

records.addlTxt: Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, the motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. David Swanson, Br. 11, calendar successor, for review. spc

Counts one and two.  

(return address: Cecilio Garcia #632144, FCCC, 2825 N. 30th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53210)

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original PLEA & SENTENCING Transcript (65 pages) commencing JULY 8, 2015 received and filed.
Decision and Order DENYING Request To Reconsider Eligibility For Early Release Programs received, signed, and filed with court.
Per order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Daniel L. Konkol, Br. 44, calendar successor, for review. mag
Defendant's pro se request to reconsider eligibility for earned release program.

Defendant Cecilio Albert Garcia in court with attorney Scott Paley Phillips Law Offices.  Marissa Luz Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 2:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court also advises defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by: Mother, Jeanette G., Father, Felix Q., and Uncle, Alberto R.

AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 7 YEARS, 6 MONTHS, CONCURRENT TO COUNT 2, and CONSECUTIVE with any other sentence, with credit for 3 DAYS time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 3 YEAR 6 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 4 YEARS.  The defendant IS NOT ELIGIBLE for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program and IS NOT ELIGIBLE for the Challenge Incarceration Program. 

AS TO COUNT 2:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 7 YEARS, 6 MONTHS, CONCURRENT TO COUNT 1, and CONSECUTIVE with any other sentence, with credit for 3 DAYS time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 3 YEAR 6 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 4 YEARS.  The defendant IS NOT ELIGIBLE for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program and IS NOT ELIGIBLE for the Challenge Incarceration Program. 

The Court imposed the following conditions of extended supervision:  

- AODA assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety, no controlled substances without a valid prescription, with random drug tests and breathalyzers.
- Seek and maintain full time employment.
- No association with known drug users or dealers, and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
- Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample, and to pay all MANDATORY COURT costs, fees, assessments, and surcharges through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Cash bail to apply.  Defendant to make regular monthly payments.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
- Pay all supervision fees.  Defendant to make regular payments.
- ANY treatment and counseling programs as determined by agent.

Court ordered that the defendant cannot vote until civil rights are restored upon completion of sentence.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon that he may never possess a firearm.
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.

DEFENDANT IS REMANDED INTO CUSTODY.

Received and filed:
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgment;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit;
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.  aw

Defendant Cecilio Albert Garcia in court with attorney Scott Paley Phillips Law Offices.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
No DA assigned to the case yet.  Defense counsel to pick up additional discovery today.  All motions due within two weeks.  Case set for plea and sentencing.  Case adjourned for plea and sentencing on 7/8/2015 at 1:30 pm, branch 3.  Court reminds defendant to not use or possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription.  aw  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 8, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Affirmation for the state:Gregory Borst-MPD Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 03.

Defendant Cecilio Albert Garcia in court with attorney Scott Paley Phillips Law Offices.  Brandon Wigley for Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    
Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Stark.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Fiorenza, Br. 03.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Cash bail that was previously posted to remain. Oral No Weapons Order, No use or possession of any controlled substances without a valid prescription  Preliminary hearing scheduled for 05-01-2015 at 01:30 pm.
